title: MySQLSYSDATE()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLSYSDATE()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Return the current date and time:
SELECT SYSDATE();

Definition and Usage
The SYSDATE() function returns the current date and time.
Note:
The date and time is returned as "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS" 
(string) or as YYYYMMDDHHMMSS (numeric).
Syntax
SYSDATE()
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0
More Examples
Example
Return the current date and time + 1:
SELECT SYSDATE() + 1;

★
+1

quiz.question: What is The date and time?
options:
returned as "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS" 
(string) or as YYYYMMDDHHMMSS (numeric)
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of The date and time is 'returned as "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS" 
(string) or as YYYYMMDDHHMMSS (numeric)'.
